caseName: The Official Stanford Investors Committee v. Greenberg Traurig, LLP
firm: Charles A. Green Law Office, PLLC
Fogler Brar Ford O'Neil & Gray LLP

recap_documents.description: ORDER: This Order addresses Defendants Greenberg Traurig's ("Greenberg") motion for partial dismissal  27 , Hunton & Williams LLP's ("Hunton") motion to dismiss  49 , and Yolanda Suarez's motion to dismiss  56 .  The Court grants Defendants' motions in part and denies them in part. The Court dismisses with prejudice Plaintiffs' claims for aiding and abetting fraudulent transfers against all Defendants. The Court dismisses without prejudice Plaintiff s' claims against Greenberg and Hunton for breach of fiduciary duty. The Court denies Defendants' motions to dismiss the Receiver's and OSIC's claims in all other regards. The Court grants Plaintiffs leave to replead the breach of fiduciary duty claims within thirty (30) days from the date of this Order.            (Ordered by Judge David C Godbey on 12/17/2014)  (ctf)
